member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession
member.summary: Drawing sessions are used to issue graphics drawing commands. This is the main way to draw things onto a canvas.

remarks.p: For best performance, graphics drawing commands need to be batched into groups so the GPU hardware can process as many operations as possible in parallel. Win2D achieves this through the CanvasDrawingSession API. A drawing session represents an active batch of commands that are in the process of being generated. Use its various methods to indicate what you want to draw, then when you dispose the CanvasDrawingSession the entire batch will be optimized and submitted for the GPU hardware to carry out the drawing.
Drawing sessions can be obtained in various different ways. Most often, you should use the one that is passed in to the CanvasControl.Draw event handler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Clear(Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Clears to the specified color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage)
member.summary: Draws an image positioned at the origin.
member.remarks: This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws an image at the specified position.
member.remarks: This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.summary: Draws an image at the specified position.
member.remarks: This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.summary: Draw an image at the specified position, with the specified source rect and linear image interpolation.
member.remarks: This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector2,Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite)
member.summary: Draw an image at the specified position, with the specified source rect, the specified image interpolation and composite mode.
member.remarks: Because the composite mode is explicitly specified, this overload ignores the current setting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasDrawingSession.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Units
member.summary: Sets what units are used to specifiy coordinates for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Transform
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix that will be applied to subsequent drawing calls on this drawing session.

remarks.p: Transform may be changed multiple times in a single drawing session.
The example below demonstrates what happens when Transform is assigned different values within a single drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.TextAntialiasing
member.summary: Sets the text antialiasing mode for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Blend
member.summary: Sets the blend mode for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Antialiasing
member.summary: Enables or disables primitive edge antialiasing for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Device
member.summary: Gets the underlying device used by this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Dpi
member.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch (DPI) of this drawing session.

remarks.p: DPI describes the ratio between device independent pixels (dips) and actual physical pixels. The identity DPI value is 96, which means dips and pixels are the same.
Drawing sessions inherit their DPI from the , or they were created from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.ConvertPixelsToDips(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts units from physical pixels to device independent pixels (dips) based on the DPI of this drawing session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.ConvertDipsToPixels(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts units from device independent pixels (dips) to physical pixels based on the DPI of this drawing session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite
member.summary: The composite mode used for the effect.

remarks.p: The equations listed in enum descriptions use these elements: O = Output S = Source SA = Source Alpha D = Destination DA = Destination Alpha

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = DA * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOut
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOut
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceAtop
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = DA * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Xor
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with xor function for pixels that overlap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Add
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Copy
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.BoundedCopy
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with no destination override. Equation: O = S (only where source exists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.MaskInvert
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with unchanged alpha. Equation: O = (1 - D) * S + (1 - SA) * D.
